title: Alexiewicz norm
summary: In mathematics — specifically, in integration theory — the Alexiewicz norm is an integral norm associated to the Henstock–Kurzweil integral.  The Alexiewicz norm turns the space of Henstock–Kurzweil integrable functions into a topological vector space that is barrelled but not complete.  The Alexiewicz norm is named after the Polish mathematician Andrzej Alexiewicz, who introduced it in 1948.
